title: If a student misbehaves in the classroom and the teacher lets him sit on the so-called 'hot seat', is this considered corporal punishment? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Same answer for almost exactly the same question you just asked earlier: No. Corporal punishment is physical. Like a spanking or cracking the knuckles or palms with a ruler as was sometimes done in ages past. Why? Because sitting in front of the clase is not the definition of corporal punishment. From dictionary: Corporal Punishment - physical punishment, such as caning or flogging. No matter how many times you ask the same question the answers aren’t going to change.

No. At least not in the UK (or unless “hot seat” is a metaphor here). In the UK ‘corporal punishment’ has a very specific meaning. Something along these lines:  It comes from the Latin ‘corpus’, meaning harm to the body. I am old enough that I was subjected to corporal punishment a fair bit during my school days (I was not a well behaved child). The only ‘hot seat’ was when you tried to sit down again afterwards. Corporal punishment - Wikipedia
